H1.body:
a. Undigested; unde-
composed. --rRaM, --rRiH f. 1 Indigestion;
ajIrRe BezajaM vAri jIrRe vAri balapradam,
ajIrRe BojanaM vizaM; kErajIrRaBayAdBrAtarBo-
janaM parihIyate H. 2. 57, Ms. 4. 121.
--2 Vigour, energy, absence of decay.

a. Grown to excess; ºQo
hi nArIRAmakAlajYo manoBavaH R. 12. 33.
--QaM, --QiH f. A very high position, great
elevation or rise; atyArUQirBavati maha-
tAmapyapaBraMSanizWA S. 4. v. 1.; atyArUQaM
ripoH soQaM caMdaneneva BoginaH R. 10. 42.

p. p. Repeated, recited
after; occurring in the text studied.
--ktaM, --ktiH f. 1 Subsequent mention;
repetition by way of explanation or
illustration. --2 Study of the Vedas.

f. Becoming complete;
complete number.

a. Not afraid, fear-
less. --tiH f. 1 Fearlessness. --2 Ap-
proach, attack. --3 Nearness.

a. Ved. 1 Not consump-
tive, healthy. --2 Causing health.
--kzmaM Healthiness, freedom from dis-
ease. --Comp. --karaRa a. causing
health, making healthy and sound.
--tAtiH f. health.

a. 1 Fit to be condemn-
ed, censurable, not to be praised;
na cApi kAvyaM navamityavadyaM M. 1.
2; kimavadyaH karikuMBajo maRiH Si. 16.
45. --2 Defective, faulty, blamable,
disagreeable, disliked; udavahadanavadyAM
tAmavadyAdapetaH R. 7. 70; see anavadya
also. --3 Unfit to be told. --4 Low,
inferior. --5 Sinful. --dyaM 1 A fault,
defect, imperfection. --2 Sin, vice.
--3 Blame, censure, reproach; udava-
hadanavadyAM tAmavadyAdapetaH R. 7. 70. --4
Shame. --Comp. --gohana a. conceal-
ing or keeping off want. --BIH f.
fear of vices or sin.

a. Not extending to the
whole circumstances, not pervading
the whole extent; vahnirDUmasyAvyApyaH.
--Comp. --vfttiH f. (In Vais. phil.) a
category of limited application,
partial inherence with regard to [Page0199-c+ 56]
time or space, as pleasure, pain &c.;
avyApyavfttiH kzaRiko viSezaguRa izyate Bha11-
sha11 P. 27.

p. p. [kzaR-kta] 1 Wounded, hurt,
injured, bitten, torn, rent, broken
down &c.; see kzaR; raktaprasADitaBuvaH
kzatavigrahASca Ve. 1. 7; Ku. 4. 6; R.
1. 28; 2. 56; 3. 53. --2 Diminished;
trodden. --taM 1 Scratching, a scratch.
--2 A wound, hurt, injury; kzate pra-
hArA nipataMtyaBIkzRaM Pt. 2. 178; kzate kzA-
ramivAsahyaM jAtaM tasyEva darSanaM U. 4. 7;
kzAraM kzate prakzipan Mk. 5. 18; naKaº Ku.
3. 29. --3 Danger, destruction, peril;
kzatAt kila trAyata ityudagraH R. 2. 53.
--Comp. --ari a. victorious. --udaraM
dysentery. --kAsaH a cough pro-
duced by injury. --jaM 1. blood; sa
CinnamUlaH kzatajena reRuH R. 7. 43; Ve.
2. 27. --2. puss, matter. --yoniH f.
a violated woman, a woman who is
no longer a virgin. --vikzata a. man-
gled, covered with cuts and wounds.
--vfttiH f. destitution, being de-
prived of any means of support.
--vrataH a student who has violated his
vow or religious engagements. --haraM
aloewood.

p. p. 1 Dug up, excavated,
bored; kIwaº Pt. 2. 89. --2
Torn, rent. --taM 1 An excavation.
--2 A hole. --3 A ditch, moat; Pt.
5. 29. --4 An oblong pond. --5 A
cavern. --6 Digging a hole. --tA An
artificial pond. --Comp. --BUH f. a
moat, ditch. --rUpakAraH a potter.

a. Stammering, stuttering
faltering; tatkiM rodizi gadgadena vacasA
Amaru. 53; gadgadagalastryuwyadvilInAkzaraM
ko dehIti vadet Bh. 3. 8; sAnaMdagadgadapadaM
harirityuvAca Gi10t. 10. --daM ind. In a
faltering or stammering tone; vilalA-
pa sa bAzpagadgadaM R. 8. 43; ºnadat U. 2. 30
producing a gurgling sound. --daH, --da
1 Stammering. --2 Indistinct or
convulsive speech. --Comp. --DvaniH
a low, inarticulate sound expressive
of joy or grief. --padaM inarticulate
speech. --vAc f. inarticulate or con-
vulsive speech, interrupted by sob-
bing &c. --svara a. uttering stammer-
ing sounds. (--raH) 1. indistinct or
stammering utterance. --2. a buffalo.

a. The third. --yaM A third
part. --Comp. --prakftiH m. or f. 1. a
eunuch. --2. the neuter gender.

f. [tF-karaRe adi] 1 A boat.
--2 A kind of duck (kAraMqava).

a. [paR-karmaRi yat] 1 Saleable,
vendible. --2 To be transacted. --RyaH
1 A ware, an article, a commodity; pU-
rAbaBAse vipaRisTapaRyA R. 16. 41; pa-
RyAnAM gAMDikaM paRyaM Pt. 1. 13; sOBAgyapa-
RyAkaraH Mk. 8. 38; Ms. 5. 129; M.
1. 17; Y. 2. 245. --2 Trade, busi-
ness. --3 Price; mahatA puRyapaRyena
krIteyaM kAyanOstvayA Sa10nti. 3. 1.
--Comp. --aMganA, --yozit f., --vilA-
sinI, --strI f. a harlot, a courtezan;
paRyastrIzu vivekakalpalatikASastrIzurajye-
ta kaH Bh. 1. 90; Me. 25. --ajiraM
a market. --AjIvaH a trader. --A-
jIvakaM a market, fair. --patiH a great [Page0660-b+ 56]
merchant. --PalatvaM prosperity or
profit in trade. --BUmiH f. a ware-
house. --vITikA, --vITI, --SAlA 1.
a market. --2. a stall, shop.

f. 1 An assembly, a
meeting, council, audience; aBirU-
paBUyizWA parizadiyaM S. 1. --2 A religious
assembly or synod. --3 A group, col-
lection, circle; U. 4. 19.

a. Bounded by, extending
as far as; sapudaparyaMtA pfTvI ‘the ocean-
bounded earth’. --taH 1 Circuit. cir-
cumference. --2 Skirt, edge, border.
extremity, boundary; uwajaparyaMtacA-
riRI S. 4: paryatavanaM R. 13. 38; Rs.
3. 3. --3 Side, flank; Ratn. 2. 3:
R. 18. 43. --4 End, conclusion, ter-
mination; Pt. 1. 125. --Comp. --de-
SaH, --BUH, --BUmiH f. an adjoining district
or region. --parvataH an adjoining hill.

a. [Bf-kyap tak ca] To be
nourished or maintained &c. --tyaH
1 Any one requiring to be support-
ed. --2 A servant, dependant, slave.
--3 A king's servant, minister of
state; H. 2. 142. --4 A subject. --tyA
1 Rearing, fostering, nourishing,
taking care of; as in kumAraBftyA q. v.
--2 Maintenance, support. --3 A means
of sustenance, food. --4 Wages. --5
Service. --Comp --aDyApanaM teaching
the Veda for hire. --janaH 1. a servant,
dependant. --2. servants taken col-
lectively. --Bartf m. the master of a
family. --vargaH the body of servants.
--vAtsalyaM kindness to servants. --vf-
ttiH f. maintenance of servants;
Ms. 11. 7.

a. [manorapatyaM yat suk ca],
Friendly or useful to man. --zyaH
1 A man, human being, mortal. --2
A male. --3 Ved. A class of manes.
--Comp. --iMdraH, ISvaH a king, sove-
reign; R. 2. 2. --karaH human ex-
ertion or effort; cf. puruzakAra. --jAtiH.
f. mankind, human race. --devaH 1. a
king; R. 2. 52. --2. a god amoug
men, a Bra10hman2a. --DarmaH 1. the
duty of man. --2. the character of
man, human character. --varmana m. an
epithet of Kubera. --mAraRaM homicide.
--yajYaH hospitality, hospitable recep-
tion of guests, one of the five daily
acts of a house-holder; see nfyajYa.
--lokaH the world of mortals, the
earth. --viS, --viSA f., --viSaM hu-
man race, mankind. --SoRitaM hu-
man blood; (papO) kutUhaleneva manuzyaSo-
RitaM R. 3. 54. --saBA 1. an assem-
bly of men. --2. a crowd, multitude. [Page0842-c+ 55]
--3. a place of meeting, assembly.

f. [mud-kvip vA wAp] Joy,
delight, pleasure, gladness, satisfac-
tion; piturmudaM tena tatAna so'rBakaH R. 3.
25; aSnan puro haritako mudamAdaDAnaH Si.
5. 58; 1. 23; vizAde kartavye vidaDati
jaqAH pratyuta mudaM Bh. 3. 25; dviparaRamudA
Gi10t. 11; Ki. 5. 25; R. 7. 30.

a. 1 Sprinkling, fertilizing.
--2 Strong, stout. --RaH The scrotum,
the bag containing the testicles.
--Comp. --kacCUH f. ulceration of
the scrotum.

a. nI f. [Sam Ric lyu lyuw vA]
Quelling, allaying, subduing &c.
--naM 1 Appeasing, allaying, sooth-
ing, conquering, alleviating, &c. --2
Calmness, tranquillity. --3 End,
stop, cessation, destruction. --4 Hurt-
ing, injuring. --5 Killing animals
for sacrifice, immolation. --6 Swal-
lowing, chewing. --naH 1 A kind of
deer, an antelope. --2 N of Yama,
the god of death. --Comp. --svasf f.
'Yama's sister', epithet of the river
Yamuna10.

a. nI f.) [Sakuna-aR] 1
Relating to birds; Ms. 3. 268. --2
Relating to omens. --3 Ominous.

a. ktI f. [SaktirdevatA'sya
aR.] 1 Relating to power. --2 Re- [Page1039-a+ 56]
lating to Sakti or the female personi-
fication of divine energy --ktaH A
worshipper of Sakti; (the Sa10ktas
are generally worshippers of Durga10
representing the female personifica-
tion of divine energy, and the ritual
enjoined to them is of two kinds,
the pure or right-hand ritual dakziRA-
cAra, and impure or left-hand ritual
vAmAcAra q. q. v. v.).

a. kI f. Expiatory,
propitiatory. --kaM Observances or
ceremonies calculated to remove
calamities.

a. kI f. Bodily, cor-
poreal, material.

f. Ved. 1 Beauty, splendour.
--2 Radiance, lustre. --3 Happiness.
--4 Victory. --5 An ornament. --6 An
auspicious offering. --7 Water. --8
A brilliant chariot.

[hal GaYarTe karaRe ka] A plough; [Page1167-c+ 55]
vahasi vapuzi viSade vasanaM jaladABam . hala-
hatiBItimilitayamunABam; or halaM kalayate
Gi10t. 1. --2 Deformity, ugliness.
--Comp. --AyuDaH an epithet of
Balara10ma. --Dara, --Bft m. 1. a plough-
man. --2. N. of Balara10ma; keSava Dfta-
halaDararUpa jaya jagadISa hare Gi10t. 1; aM-
sanyaste sati halaBfto mecake vAsasIva Me.
59. --BUtiH, --BftiH f. ploughing, agri-
culture, husbandry. --hatiH f. 1.
striking or drawing along with a
plough. --2. ploughing.
